definition: a person chosen, named, or honored as a special guardian, protector, or supporter
a wealthy or influential supporter of an artist or writer
examples: … the unspoken contract between artist and patron …

definition: a social or financial sponsor of a social function (such as a ball or concert)
examples: a patron of the annual masked ball

definition: one that uses wealth or influence to help an individual, an institution, or a cause
examples: a patron of the city library

definition: one who buys the goods or uses the services offered especially by an establishment
the holder of the right of presentation to an English ecclesiastical benefice
a master (see master entry 1 sense 2g) in ancient times who freed a person he had held in slavery but retained some rights over that person
the proprietor of an establishment (such as an inn) especially in France
the chief male officer in some fraternal lodges having both men and women members
